name: Muhammad Haris Rehman
event_review: It was most detailed and comprehensive session ever
answer1: Forking is simply a copy of a repository that allows you to freely experiment with changes without affecting the original project ,Cloning is when I create a new repository on GitHub, it exists as a remote location where my project is stored. I can clone my repository to create a local copy on my computer so that I can sync between both the local and remote locations of the project.And when I fork I won’t be able to pull down changes from the original repository I cloned from, and if the project is owned by someone else I won’t be able to contribute back to it.
answer2: A 'pull request' is you requesting the target repository to please grab your changes.A 'push' request would be the target repository requesting you to push your changes.
